title: Stop pretending Ekko "doesn't have burst" and give his ult a mana cost.
body: There is no reason for an ASSASSIN to have this much safety. I can deal with his mobility, cc and damage. But unless Ekko falls asleep there is no punishing him after long fights. I would have expected 100 and upwards to 150 mana cost on an ult like this but nope it costs nothing. Because fuck it all. Currently Ekko builds 0 mana items and just spams Q and W all day and if things go bad just R. Maybe if his ult wasn't an aoe tactical nuke it could cost 0 mana but I am not seeing the downsides to his ult at all. Which is the counterplay when you are an Assassin. SOMETHING has a downside in which your enemy can punish you hard with. "Crap I can't use my escape because I spammed all day."

replies.body:
So first of all, giving his ult a mana cost is not likely to solve any of the frustration problems it might have.  In the vast majority of fights it's going to be used the same way, under the same contexts.  If the spell needs a downside (not saying it does) giving it a mana cost isn't going to solve that.

That said, from a design standpoint I do agree that there is something to the idea of "he's been spamming spells and is out of mana, now is my chance to strike."  His ult not having a cost directly avoids the minor gameplay idea of "characters are weak when they're OOM."  My bad on that one.  We'll be fixing it for 5.12 by upping the cost to 100 (from 0).  There were localization things that prevented it getting in for 5.11. 

As a side note, adding higher mana costs across Ekko's kit (we're also upping W cost to 50 from 30 in 5.11) helps mitigate burst in an indirect manner.  Higher costs means he has a harder time farming and may want to invest in more mana/regen itemization. More gold spent on mana + less gold overall = lower AP totals at X point in the game.

A designer actually  taking the blame and apologizing for how their champion turned out in the eyes of the community, and then sympathizing with how we feel.  It's beautiful.  

>Higher costs means he has a harder time farming and may want to invest in more mana/regen itemization. 

Is that a bad thing?  I thought assassins weren't supposed to have safe, reliable farming.  Isn't that why a select _many_ got butchered or had their champion class reassigned?  

Why not tone back his scaling a bit and make him into a bruiser?  Another reason Riot gave for gutting assassins was that they shouldn't have a lot of utility and Ekko...has WAY TOO MUCH utility for doing that much damage...

You should either hit his scaling and make him into a bruiser, or if you want to keep true to the assassin image you had for him, he needs his utility run over with a truck.

Then you realize that Ekko actually has LESS damage than other AP Assassins, and makes up for it with utility. SEE DIANA {{champion:131}} :

- ~~More Base Damage,~~ Higher Ratios
- Instant Shield
- Faster Burst
- Naturally Tankier because of this shield

Then you see LeBlanc {{champion:7}} :

- Higher Damage by about ~~800~~ 500
- More safety
- More mobility

Ekko makes up for it by having MORE utility! Also, his skills are all highly telegraphed, unlike "insta-nuke across the lane LeBlanc".

Passive: Takes 3 stacks to activate... if you get 1 or 2 stacks, be smart and back off until it's gone. This has helped me every time I've played against him.

Q: If you get hit by the first part, simply walk to the side... and VOILA! You were only hit by one part. You don't need a dash to get out of slow... look at my username! I can walk out of the Q as Mordekaiser.

W: 3 second delay... THREE SECONDS! Don't make the excuse of "you can only see it 0.5 seconds before it hits". That doesnt matter! If he was able to STILL guess where you were going to be in 3 seconds, then he outplayed you. Also, what NO ONE else notices is that when he activates his W, you can see the hologram come out, and hear him say some quote, I think it's "watch out". Something like that... so once again, another easy way to get out of the way.

R: Everyone complains about that "insane" damage, but no one realizes that it's extremely easy to avoid. Stay away from the hologram = don't take damage. If you're chasing an Ekko and you're low, expect to get destroyed if you're right next his hologram. Avoid it... that's another "tip" I've been using that has let me easily go up against Ekko. Also, his ult's damage makes up for most of his damage as a champ, and he still has less damage than a lot of other assassins. Lowering the damage on this skill wouldn't solve anything.

Learn how a champion works... adapt. Learn how the champion differs from other champs. Ekko has slower burst, damage, and reliability than most other similar champions.

If you wanna learn Morde, just play him non-stop for awhile. He's actually a very simple champion, and pretty easy to learn. One of the biggest things to learn about him if you're using quickcast, which you should be doing, is the range of his E. If you can learn the range of that, then you can poke an enemy in lane and last hit specific minions without pushing your lane too quickly. Most of the time, you'll be pushing your lane without even trying though, so always ward up. Upgrade your trinket ASAP. Mordekaiser is weak against ganks, so get that trinket whenever you can, and always, even if you think you need that gold, buy wards. WARDS! Ok? Ok :D 

Besides that, Mordekaiser doesn't scale as well as most Mages with AP, because his ratios aren't that great. 

Get that Hextech first > get some boots early > if you're against someone squishy, and you're doing well, get Luden's. Funny thing about Luden's with Mordekaiser that has secured me manyyyyyy kills when they run away (this may not work since they nerfed Luden's). When you ult someone, and they manage to use all of their mobility/CC and whatever to get away, spin in circles, YES CIRCLES, and spam your skills randomly into the air (DON'T HIT ANYTHING WITH THESE SKILLS). This will charge up Luden's, and each time it hits 100, Luden's will proc from anywhere on the map from whoever was ulted and hurt them even more. It works, and it's an amazing way to counter that evil potion they drink.

The idea with Ekko is that he is supposed to be _the_ utility assassin, for when you need more utility and some fool to get blown up.  Taking out his utility would ruin his identity (at least the planned identity) and I would like there to be a utility option for assassination style play.

>The idea with Ekko is that he is supposed to be the **utility assassin**

In what universe is this a good idea?  

Kalista is supposed to be a mobility ADC.  The last mobility ADC {{champion:236}} got reworked a hundred times before he was tolerable.  Then they decided "Ya know what, we haven't learned from this experience.  Here T, go nuts on this new champ -  get that toxicity real deep in her kit."  

Having a unique identity doesn't mean it's excusable.  There are identities that just don't work, and these two examples are destined to be problematic and unfun for everyone but the person playing them.

I think we can safely say the following identities, to the best of everyone's knowledge, NEVER work:
-Tank Assassin (Lee Sin and Elise, and yes I know that wasn't the intended role for either champion)
-Safe Assassin (LB, Zed pre-nerf, Ekko to some extent)
-Mobility ANYTHING except Support (because at this point Riot can't be trusted making mobile champions)

IMO, there is nothing wrong with a utility assassin.  Ekko's problems are rooted in the fact that he pays ALMOST NOTHING for his utility.  I mean, his ult has crazy outplay potential with the flash-back and heal......and does more damage than Veigar ult in an AoE.  His passive slows......and also deals a crapton of damage.  His E lets him jump two walls......and applies on-hit effects, spell effects and his passive.  Sure, he has slightly less damage than other assassins, but he actually has more sheer utility than some supports.
I want a law against anybody being allowed to do more dmg than Veigar's ult :<

After getting some experience fighting ekko the only thing that really bothers me is that you more or less have to kill him 'twice' unless you can 100-0 him while he is under cc that prevents spell casting. That requires poor positioning on his part and misplaying his dash. He feels very tryndameresque in being a high damage squishy that you just can't kill in a reasonable time frame. 

A capable ekko seems to dictate how teamfights go regardless of who else is in the game. The ult pressure is immense and basically you're just running away from his ghost because you all die if he ults, but you also can''t kill him unless you blow all of your cc to do it. It feels like ekko's kit just puts way too much pressure on the other team without really feeling any pressure back at him because he's so safe.
